questions.answer:

questions.title: Describe two development methodologies and their application
questions.description: This is a description in detail of two development methodologies and their application
questions.question: Describe two development methodologies and their application
questions.answer:
The Waterfall model which is the classical approach, is a rigid and linear method. Distinct goals for each phase of development where after earch phase has completed the next one starts and there is no turning back. Waterfall model is more applicable where the project is small.

The Spiral model focuses on early Identification and reduction of project risks. Spiral project starts on small scale which after exploring and handling risks then decides whether to take the next step in the project. Spiral model is more applicable where the project is large.

questions.title: Outline the principles of language development
questions.description: This is a description in detail of principles of language development
questions.question: Outline the principles of language development
questions.answer:
Outline of the principles of language development:

Principle 1: Testing

The testing of a piece of software if Principle to programming development, even if you think there if no way the piece of code (No matter how small) cannot break, think again. The smallest error in a large system can produce catastrophic problems even ones that are hard to detect unless properly tested.

Principle 2: Keep it simple, Stupid! (KISS)

A design should be as simple as possible, but no simpler. Usually the more elegant a design, the simpler it is. It takes alot of work and iterations to simplify but the payoff is software that is less error-prone and maintainable.

Principle 3: Maintain the Vision

A clear and uncompromising vision of a software system enforces compliance and helps ensure that the software project turns out successfully. Without vision and compromising results in patchwork system with conflicting designs.

questions.title: Outline the basic principles of project management
questions.description: This is a description in detail of basic principles of project management
questions.question: Outline the basic principles of project management
questions.answer:
The basic principles of project management are as follows:

  • Project Structure: Revolves around three main parameters. Project Goal which is what has to be done. Project Timeline and Order which is a visualized start and end point of the project with all other packages. Project Milestones which are the certain phases of your project.
  • Definition Phase: Without a clear definition the project can go horribly wrong.
  • Transparency About the Project Status: Project manager should keep track of project and give short reports of project status to higher ups.
  • Risk Recognition: Identify risks early on to nip negative developments.
  • Managing Project Disturbances: Develop strategies to avoid or negate risks when possible.
  • Responsibility Of The Project Manager: Project manager develops the project plan with the team, secure acceptance and approval of deliverables from the Project Sponsor and Stakeholders.

questions.title: Key features of the software development life cycle (SDLC)
questions.description: This is a description in detail of the key features of the software development life cycle (SDLC)
questions.question: Describe the key features of the software development life cycle (SDLC)
questions.answer:
The key features are as follows:

  • Each phase of the life cycle has its own process that feeds into the next phase.
  • When information becomes more available phases can overlap as previous phases are revisted.
  • Iterative risk management system where as the project moves onto completion it increasingly becomes more developed.
